titleInfo.title: 'File 6/84 Miscellaneous help to Shaikh and his Relatives'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 12; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located at the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-9; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Adviser to the Government of Bahrain (Charles Dalrymple Belgrave), the Political Agency in Bahrain, the British Consul at Baghdad, and Shaikh Ahmed bin Hamdan Al Sultan bin Saqor of Braimi [Buraimi].The correspondence covers a few miscellaneous matters, as follows:Shaikh Salman bin Hamad Al Khalifah's interest in sending a relative, Shaikh Ibrahim bin Mohamed bin Isa, to Agricultural College in Egypt;a request by Shaikh Ahmed bin Hamdan Al Sultan bin Saqor for employment in Bahrain;Shaikh Ali bin Abdullah Al Khalifah's wish to sell one of his vehicles;petrol issued in Iraq to Shaikh Mohamed Ibn Issa El Khalifeh [Muḥammad bin ‘Īsá Āl Khalīfah] by the Iraq Petrolem Company Limited and the question of how it is to be replaced.Folios 10-11 are internal office notes.
